data.text:
@HeQther17 @CBS2Boise Calm down little friend.

Remember: everything you believe is wrong.

@smoked999 @CBS2Boise You are actually saying that those people, who would still be here with us were it not for Covid (and the way people around them decided to manage it) do not matter, and that only the lives of those who were healthy and then died from 100% Covid have any value.
@realrealitybit1 @CBS2Boise If you had leukemia for years, and then you got Covid and died. Covid killed you. Covid was the straw that broke your back

@CBS2Boise Worldwide Covid:
Cases 446M +1.15M /Deaths 6M +3,949
Worldwide - Recovered: 380,429,270
United States Covid:
Cases 79.2M +6,753 / Deaths 957K +212

Source: Our World in Data - collaborative effort between researchers at the University of Oxford ...
And ... https://t.co/vUkAaUtvSK
@CBS2Boise Because everything we were told was logical.... https://t.co/U4gnaJg2E1

@CBS2Boise could we please be honest?  4 comorbidities is not really dying of covid.  What are the real numbers?  My understanding of CDC data is that "pure" Covid deaths are 300,000.  Not 6 million.  That is typical influenza death number.

@CBS2Boise What a bunch of callous assholes commenting. Most of whom probably scream "all lives matter" and protest abortion. Because heaven forbid they mourn the loss of a million Americans when they can scream about 13 dead soldiers. Conservatism is a derangement.
@smoked999 @CBS2Boise Oh so it's fine because mostly old people died? So much for "all lives matter", ghoul
